Name: Estet'ik
Description:
Install, overlay, turn to create a gallery of portraits. Noses, eyes, mouths, hair and moustaches ... a crazy Tangram to recreate a portrait gallery! Or create your own wacky portraits!

With over 150 colourful cut-out shapes, players can choose one of 3 different games that are suggested in the rulebook.


     Recreate the portrait on the template card.
     Make a fun portrait using the pieces shown on the card.
     Select your own pieces and board and mix and match to make your own gallery of wacky portraits.


This components lend themselves to open-ended play.

—description from the back of the box

Released by Djeco as part of the éduludo line: "A recreational and educational collection to accompany your child in his or her first learning stages."

Name: Gloschli
Description:
A card game in which players aim to get rid of as many creatures as possible or exchange them with an opponent's card.

The first player who manages to have five or less points in their cards triggers the last round by announcing "Gloschli". Their cards are now protected and can no longer be claimed by their opponents. After the other players have finished their last turn, all players turn their cards face up. Each player's total points are calculated. As soon as the first player exceeds 100 points, the game is over and the player with the fewest points wins.

Name: Dungeon Party: Starter Set
Description:
Dungeon Party is a quick-play fantasy role-playing game played with coasters and a coin.

Dungeon Party is easy to learn, playable in a short time (or extended if that is desirable), has all of the aspects of a classic RPG adventure, and is playable in a bar, restaurant, or at home. The combat mechanism is fun and adds an element of luck and skill without much complexity. The game system is infinitely expandable.

Players will assemble a "dungeon" by creating a stack of coasters that includes rooms, monsters, and treasures. They then adventure through the dungeon by turning over tiles, battling the rooms, defeating the monsters, and looting the treasure. Along the way, they may pick up magical treasures or spells that can help them in their quest. If they survive the dungeon, the player with the most treasure points wins. If they do not, the dungeon wins. But either way, there will be laughs and maybe even a drink or two!

Battles are resolved by players trying to drop quarters on coasters. If they miss, players take hit damage. If they land on the coaster, the monsters take damage. Battles continue until either monster or player is eliminated.

—description from the publisher

Name: Okko: Legendary Journey – Oni Court
Description:
This expansion for Okko - oni Hunters greatly complicates the task of Okko and his companions. Can they accept the new challenge and save Pajan's empire from falling into the hands of the dark forces that covet it?
This expansion makes the final battle against the Oni richer and at times more difficult by introducing a variety of demonic creatures, each one different from the other.

Name: Okko: Legendary Journey – Heroes' Inn
Description:
This expansion for Okko Oni Hunters allows you to diversify the enemies encountered during the journey of the group of adventurers, to make the acquaintance of the great elemental masters but also to grant your heroes well-deserved rests at crucial stages of their journey!
This expansion, in addition to its 2 new heroes, brings many welcome advantages to the adventurers, but be careful not to overdo it or you'll get bad karma.

Name: Drugs/Alcohol: Play It Straight
Description:
Drugs/Alcohol Play it Straight Game is very educational for Red Ribbon Week or Alcohol Prevention Program


Use this during Red Ribbon Week and provide a wide variety of activities that can be used with children and adults.  Players move around the board by the "safe" or the "risk" path and must look at options, make decisions, and answer questions about drugs and alcohol.  It's packed with hard-hitting information and thought-provoking real-life and imaginary situations.  2-5 players.  Grades 2-Adult.  Please check our more Red Ribbon Week items on our website!

Name: Okko: Legendary Journey – Pajan War
Description:
This expansion for Okko Oni Hunters takes into account the Pajan War taking place as Okko and his companions travel the roads of the empire. The conquests of the various great families will, of course, have consequences for our heroes' adventurers!
This expansion expands the adventurers' horizons and they will see that everywhere in the Pajan Empire, the evil threat of the Onis lurks.

Name: Common Decency
Description:
Scandalise your friends, startle your colleagues and unnerve your casual acquaintances with this irreverent party game!

Read a card aloud and on the count of three, everyone points to the person most likely to answer yes to that question. If everyone guesses right, dispose of the question card. If everyone guesses wrong, gain another question card. The goal is to get rid of all of your question cards, or have the least at the end of the game.

Name: Hatterasopoly
Description: A custom board game, similar to Monopoly, but based on Hatteras, NC.

Name: Armada: Magic Deck
Description: These optional rules and cards for Armada will add a sparkle of magic to your flee with a new Magic Phase and a new layer of tactics and excitement.  Contains spell-books for Basilean, Orc, Dwarf, Empire of Dust and Kingdoms of Men Fleets.

Name: Talisman: Harry Potter – 2022 Promo Card Set
Description:
A pack of 2 promo cards for Talisman: Harry Potter to go with the 2022 localisation of the game into Italian and Polish.

Now also released as a promo pack in English.

Bezoar - Outer Ring Encounter Card

Felix Felicis - Middle Ring Encounter Card

Note: The pack will be available separately as well.

Name: Kings of War: War in the Holds 2 Player Starter Set
Description:
This starter set contains two starter armies for Kings of War - The Tabletop Game of Fantasy Battles.

The set contains 44 Goblin and 42 Ratkin miniatures, a softback rulebook with army lists for 14 factions, plus a getting started booklet to help you with your first games.

Name: Share and Sparkle Unicorns
Description:
Preschool cooperative game where players are all trying to fill their unicorn's crown and necklace with gems, before the troll fills his bag with gems.  Players roll and blindly take gems out of the bag and place any that match openings on their unicorn board.  Any that can't be played are given to the troll.  Any red gems will go straight to the trolls bag and a red gem token is drawn that will either be good for the unicorns or good for the troll.  Players can also roll to share the gem they draw and they'll share all the gems they draw once they finish their unicorn. Play until all of the unicorns have all of their gems or the troll has filled his sack with gems.

—description from the designer

Name: Highlights: Hidden Pictures – Flashlight Search Game
Description:
Team up and work together to search for 150 things to find in this nighttime carnival scene loaded with surprises. Use your Flashlight wand to make the scene on the game board magically appear, and hunt for cleverly hidden things to find on a game board measuring over 3 feet long. Look carefully, because all objects are cleverly disguised in a variety of Hidden Pictures ways. The trickier the search, the more points you can score. Race to be the first team to find enough things to score the most points and win!

—description from the designer

Name: QE: Commodities
Description:
Q.E. Commodities now presents new investment opportunities for each country! As an expansion to Q.E., you will now have the ability to diversify your portfolio by investing in gold, oil, and crypto. Each commodity adds additional variable victory points to bolster your score. The biggest element of the expansion however is that it now enables you to lower your total spend throughout the game, providing extra layers of strategy and unexpected twists!

-description from publisher

Name: Baby Boomer Bingo
Description:
A boomer comment is read and all players decide which of their cards is the best younger generation response -- as well as the one that will benefit their bingo card the most.  When the best response is chosen, that becomes the bingo call!  Cross off the matching boomer/color combo on your bingo board if you have it.  First to get a bingo wins -- but doesn't everyone win when you have a good laugh?

—description from the designer

Name: Feisty Dice
Description:
A roll and write game where players are trying to be the first to fill in their colored dry-erase boards.  Roll your dice and decide what to keep and what to re-roll.  After 2 rolls decide which dice to score on your board; you can choose all dice of one color or exactly one of each color.  Then keep any dice showing your color and yellow, all other players grab dice showing their color, and there are any dice left pass those to the player on your left and it's their turn.  Use special "spit fire" power two times during the game to score twice on your turn. No reading required to play this family-friendly game.

—description from the designer

Name: Bites: New Recipes
Description:
Bites: New Recipes adds exciting game changing possibilities to the core game of Bites. One of the things that made the original game so exciting and replayable were the variable scoring cards.

This expansion takes them to an entirely different level. You'll be able to play with over a dozen new rule cards that have noticeably larger effects than the cards in the base game. In addition to the rule cards, you'll have new characters and objects to play with. With this expansion, it can feel like you are playing a completely different game!

-description from publisher

Name: Scoops Meow
Description:
Scoops Meow is the purrfect flavor-matching ice cream game. Reveal a cone card and quickly memorize the flavors and toppings.  Then be the quickest to find your matching ice cream and wafer cards. If you think you've got it right, place your face down cards in front of you.  IF you're the first, grab a cherry and put it on top of your cards. Once everyone is done reveal and everyone who is correct grabs a cherry.  If the player who was first was correct, they also get to keep their bonus cherry. First player to reach 7 or more cherries will win the game!

—description from the designer

Name: North Idaho-opoly
Description:
An unofficial Monopoly-style game featuring Idaho Panhandle lakes, state parks, outdoor recreation destinations, and a couple mines and fairs, as properties, and similar topics on random event cards.

The remainder of the game's not specific to Idaho in any way - metal playing pieces (a hand, a smile, a heart, a dog, a pretzel, and a shoe), green and red plastic houses and hotels, and "dollars" for keeping track of how long you must suffer.

Name: Kabuto Sumo: Total Mayhem
Description:
Kabuto Sumo: Total Mayhem is an expansion to the base game Kabuto Sumo.

This expansion provides all wrestlers with a variety of what pro-wrestlers call "foreign objects". Each of these objects - think ladders, chairs, coffins - are put into play both in and around the sumo ring to enhance the wild physics of all the different shapes that push each other around! Plus, each object introduces new victory conditions that can expedite the game and add more strategic depth.

—description from publisher

Name: Keep It Clean
Description:
A player reads seemingly dirty clues to the group and like "Full Service" or "Hot and Ready" and players have only a quick flip of the timer to come up with something that fits that description that is NOT dirty.  Only squeaky clean answers will score.

—description from the designer

Name: The Great Cooper's Hill Cheese Roll
Description:
The Great Coopers Hill Cheese Roll is a fast racing game of chasing a roll of cheese down a hill, based on the very real activity of doing the same. Participants are racing to be the first ones to reach the bottom hill. Alternatively, players can attempt to catch the 9-pound double Gloucester cheese as they race down the hill to be instantly victorious.

Cooper's Hill is a write and roll game where layers simultaneously will write a number between 1 and 20 and then reveal at the same time. Writing the highest number will grant the player with the fastest speed but will also make them more likely to take a injury. Based on the number you wrote and how you move on the hill you will roll dice indicating what kind of injuries you sustain.

Attempt to push you luck just enough to avoid being eliminated while still reaching the bottom the fastest.

Name: Pigskin Football
Description:
The wildest, grittiest & most extreme 2 player football board game that plays in an hour. Pigskin uses a combination of set collection, dice rolling, action selection & hand management to bring a fresh and fun way to play out a 2-player game of American football.

Pigskin has all the stats of an actual football game baked into the mechanics, including penalties, completions, yards gained, sacks, turnovers and scoring to bring you the most realistic football board game on the market that plays in about an hour.

The game uses a "mean, muscular pig player" theme with fabulous artwork on the cards as well as a beautifully designed board (football field) to really allow players to get immersed into the excitement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spire's End: Hildegard – Bows & Breakfast
Description:
Bows & Breakfast is a small, non-essential pack of 11 extra Cards that provide a touch of variety to Spire's End: Hildegard. It consists of:

2 Instruction Cards
4 Story Cards for Chapter 1
4 Story Cards for Chapter 4

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Kaldheim
Description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering takes place on Kaldheim, an icy world (or rather, cluster of ten worlds) inspired by Norse Mythology. Kaldheim consists of ten realms: Bretagard, home of the human clans; Istfell, home to the spirits of the dead; Karfell, home of the undead draugr; Immersturm, home of the demonic hordes; Gnottvold, home of the trolls; Starnheim, home of the valkyries; Surtland, home of the giants; Skemfar, home of the elves; Axgard, home of the dwarves; and Littjara, home of shapeshifters.

New mechanics in the set include foretell, which allows spells to be placed on layaway for later, and boast, which allows creatures to activate a special ability on any turn where they attack. Also included are several returning mechanics: modal double-faced cards (originally introduced in Zendikar Rising), changeling (originally introduced in Lorwyn), sagas (originally introduced in Dominaria), snow-covered lands (originally introduced in Ice Age), and snow mana (originally introduced in Coldsnap).

The set is sold in draft boosters, set boosters, collector boosters, theme boosters, and bundles, and it contains 285 cards (121 commons, 80 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 10 snow-covered basic lands). An additional 15 uncommons and 5 rares are found only in set boosters and theme boosters. The main set is also accompanied by two preconstructed commander decks that tie into its themes.

Name: Anno Domini 1666: Octavia
Description: Octavia is a 28mm metal miniature from the Hot & Dangerous range that is not only a collector item, but also a playable model in Anno Domini 1666. She is a mercenary character available to most factions. In addition to her miniature, she comes with a character card and four equipment cards.

Name: Warhammer Quest: Cursed City – Morrvahl Olbrecht
Description:
A character card for the ruthless wizard Morrvahl Olbrecht that was included with hardback and Limited Edition copies of the Cursed City tie-in novel from the Black Library. The card gives players the option to add Morrvahl Olbrecht to the pool of heroes available to undertake quests in Ulfenkarn.

Morrvahl plays quite differently from other characters in the game, possessing an attack that can damage friend and foe alike.

Players will need to provide their own miniature to represent Morrvahl on the board and he is specifically patterned after a model that can be built from the Cities of Sigmar Collegiate Arcane Mystic Battle Wizards box.

Name: Novi 1799
Description:
This game depicts the bloody and furious battle of the 2nd Coalition war that (temporarily) resulted in the loss of french dominion in northern Italy.

Each game box includes:
 One game-map,
2 sheets of counters and markers,
3 Player Aid Cards, 
a rule booklet,
an historical commentary.

The scale is 1 hour per turn, about 500 m. per hex,
Each strength point (SP) stands for  50-150 men for infantry
and cavalry (basing on their efficiency rating), and 3-5 guns.
Designer: Enrico Acerbi
Complexity: 3/5
Solitaire suitability: 4/5

Name: Lucanus
Description:
You command an army of stag beetles. They are fighting each other on a cloven oak tree. The winner takes the ultimate delicacy – the oozing sap. The rules are simple, yet the tactical and strategic approaches are nearly endless. The goal is to get three of your stag beetles to the opponent's front row first. To get there, you'll need to push the enemy bugs off onto other branches, crush them, and drop them from the tree.

The game is played on a 10 x 10 square board. You can use two or three beetles to displace one or two enemy beetles in columns and in rows. But watch out! Diagonal push moves are mandatory. Even if you don’t like the direction! It will often be convenient for you to let your opponent push your stag beetles out during the game as this will weaken their position. And you can use these weaknesses to your advantage.

Some weaknesses can become strengths during the game. It works both ways. In the beginning of a game, it is generally good to keep a lot of stag beetles in diagonals. However, the more you move into your opponent's territory, the more you must be vigilant that they don't take advantage of your diagonals. For instance, they could place their beetles behind yours just to make you push them towards your front row.

A popular tactic is to sacrifice some of your stag beetles by letting them fall off the tree or be crushed. This destabilizes your opponent's position, and you can easily sneak this move in. You can also let your opponent reach your first row with two of their beetles. By doing this, you gain a positional advantage. You can quickly place three of your beetles on the enemy's first rowg and win. The game is very dynamic. A position that may seem wrong can quickly turn everything around and let you win. You just need to find the right way.

Name: Les Mille pas
Description:
In Les Mille pas you play women in their professional lives. But this life is not a long, quiet road! Who will manage to beat the red lights and make a thousand steps?

A professional career is all about personal choices, decisions made by others, meetings, allies... In this game, you will have to find the right balance between blocking your opponents by distributing pitfalls symbolised by red lights, and helping them by finding solutions symbolised by green lights. The game tries to synthesise and make you live the adventure of a professional career between individuality and sisterhood. Throughout the game, players place step cards. The first player to accumulate 1000 steps wins the game!

Les Mille pas was created thanks to the testimonies of 700 women interviewed in 2020 about the obstacles and accelerators they encountered during their professional career. They also gave us their solutions for dealing with these inequalities. Les Mille pas is a reflection of these testimonies.'

—description from the designer

Name: Glamour
Description:
Goal!
Here’s the deal.  You’re in charge of a small group of Fairies trying to gain the favor of powerful people in the Fae Courts.  Your goal is to use your Fairy Cards (your player hand) to manipulate Dram (the little chips, basically bidding coins) to buy Court Cards (point cards).  You’ll have to use all your cunning, guile, and smooth-talkery to get the cards you need!  The first player to get a Fae from all 4 Seasonal Courts wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Dead Theorists: A Card Game for Disillusioned Philosophers and Aspiring Academics
Description:
In this turn-based card game, the ghosts of Simone De Beauvoir, W.E.B. Du Bois, Michel Foucault, and Karl Marx have returned from beyond the grave to complete a bit of unfinished business. Become the specter of one of these four great (but deceased) thinkers as you seek to recruit your last great protégé from the ranks of students on one college campus. But you’ve encountered two challenges you didn’t expect: First, the forces of neoliberalism have been hard at work dismantling the education system. It will be tough to train your final pupil from within today’s profit-oriented university. Second, you’ve got competition! Other spirits have also awoken and they’re dead set on halting your progress and advancing their own ghostly agendas. Can you train your protégé in order to complete your unfinished business — and be the first one to do it? Satirical, educational, and a ton of fun for battle-hardened academics and philosophical novices alike. Includes 81 cards and the rules in an attractive box set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: U.S. Stamps Edition
Description:
Celebrate a historical hobby enjoyed by philatelists around the world with a custom collection you can take out and play!

Created in collaboration with USPS, MONOPOLY: U.S. Stamps Edition lets players buy, sell, and trade the most memorable stamps from U.S. history!

Six USPS-inspired tokens will keep players connected to their trusty means of communication, such as a Mail Truck, Mail Box, Package, Postcard, Coil of Stamps, and USPS Eagle. Instead of Houses and Hotels, set up Post Offices and Distribution Centers to move revenue, as Chance and Community Chest cards called Special Delivery and Rain Heat & Snow create detours.

Keep your assets in superb condition to stick it to the competition and win!
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Graveyard
Description:
The game takes place at an ancient graveyard, where an evil cardinal is awakened from the dead, and has cast his curse on the graveyard. A secret occult brotherhood has hired a bunch of explorers to have the curse lifted, and the cardinal sent back to the underworld. Occult priests will help you, under way, but are you strong enough in the belief that you can succeed, and if you have luck. The mission will not be easy, many explorers have entered the graveyard, but never come out again.

Now you and your friends get the chance to fight evil, dare to work together at the graveyard, knowing that you may not escape alive, and only one of you has the chance to win.

If you dare, then let's play....

Name: Dragonbond: Battles of Valerna
Description:
Dragonbond: Battles of Valerna is a fantasy miniature wargame that brings the vibrant world of Valerna to life; players field magnificent dragons, legendary commanders, mighty heroes, powerful monsters, and brave soldiers in a desperate battle for victory.

Battles of Valerna utilizes a unique fatigue system that encourages players to make the choice between pushing their units to exhaustion or saving them for a perfect opportunity.

Players take turns activating units by placing fatigue tokens on them (the more fatigue tokens a unit has on it the less effective it becomes). Units move and attack, competing to score objective points dependent on the scenario. After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

There are three types of dice for attack and defense. If a unit is in an advantageous position they upgrade their dice to a stronger one. If they are in a disadvantageous position for example if they are flanked or exhausted, they would use a weaker dice.

When building their army, players can choose to dragonbond their mighty dragons and generals, making both even more powerful - this comes at a cost. If either unit is killed, both units are lost!

The Wargame is completely modular.  By changing the captain you can change the rules for the unit and the generals impact upon the behaviour for the entire army.

Name: COASTER games
Description:
Worthy of protecting any coffee table, this pack of random, fun coasters will also keep all party guests challenged, puzzled or simply in hysterics!

Games include: 
-Coaster Construction
-Flip and Catch Game
-Flippers
-Coaster Curling
-Conveyor Belt Game
-Decision Spinner
-Dance Tips
-Peanut Basketball
-Soccer
-Tangram puzzles
-Thumb War Arena

Name: Humblebrag
Description:
How many Eastern European countries can you name in 60 seconds? More importantly, how many can you CLAIM to know?

In Humblebrag players will boast and brag their way through a variety of different trivia topics ranging from geography to literature to Simpsons characters in a game of one upmanship that always ends with one player putting their money where their mouth is and rattling off a list of names in an effort to beat the clock!

Humblebrag isn’t just about what you know it’s also in what you can convince other players of. In the game, players take turns playing topic cards and declaring a bid of how many of that topic they can name, as play continues other players must either play a new card and raise the bid or call the previous player to find out if their bid was a bluff or a boast! This game is one part Trivial Pursuit, one part BullSh*T, and all parts fun!

Name: Dort: O Supremo Concílio
Description:
As long as Reformed doctrine is challenged by a few different theological lines emerging in the 17th century, one meeting will define everything! Britons and Gaels, Germans and Helvetics, cross its borders and unite with the Batavians in DORT for the supreme council.

Designed by Duca Siqueira and Bruno Baptista, and illustrated by André Santana, Dort: The Supreme Council is a card game for three to six players. The dynamics are simple, and involve presumptive action, voting, simultaneous action, hand management and a special touch of “take this”!

Approve some issues and reject others, use each minister's strategy and special skills to win Tulips and win the game! The fate of the Reformed faith is at stake. Are you prepared?

So, gather and vote wisely, as each choice will determine the composition of the Canons of Dort.

Name: Stratospharenflug
Description:
Stratospharenflug is a German board game produced to celebrate the first human accent into the Stratosphere On 27 May 1931 by Auguste Piccard and Paul Kipfer

The game is a simple roll and move in both a horizontal and vertical directions. The game board has a grid overlaying a landscape with red and blue numbers along the Y and X- axis (similar to the game Battleship). The dice is marked on three sides with red numbers (1 to 3) and the other sides marked with blue numbers (1 to 3). 
Players start at the bottom taking turns. If the dice shows a red number, a player ascends vertically, if it shows a blue number, then the player moves to the right into the landscape. Depending on the coloured numbers on the dice, players will ascend and travel right across the board. Once a player ascends to red 16 they are at the highest altitude and can go no higher. If a player has already reached red 16 and rolls red again, they must miss a turn. 
To win the game the players in turn continue to roll the dice for a blue number and move to the right. This is continued until number Blue 30 and Red 16 is reached (top right corner). Whoever reaches this number first is deemed the winner.
One space on the game board shows a meteor (Red 9 - Blue 18). If a player lands on this square the player is out of the game, because his balloon burns as a result of being struck by the meteor.

The game celebrates a milestone in human endeavor. The front box shows the yellow balloon and black and silver capsule that Piccard and his assistant used in 1931. They were the first people to visually observe the curvature of the earth.

Of interest to other board games, Auguste Piccard was the inspiration for Professor Calculus in The Adventures of Tintin and Captain Jean-Luc Picard in Star Trek was named after one or both of the twin brothers.

Name: Paleo: The Flash of Wit
Description: This mini expansion adds 5 new dream cards and 2 new idea cards to the base game. First it was distributed with the Spielbox 2022/2.

Name: Mythologia
Description:
Dive into the heart of ancient Greece and its mythology rich in angry gods, fearless heroes, and Homeric confrontations: 
Following the victory against their father Kronos, his children share his immense kingdom. Zeus inherits the heavens, Poseidon the oceans, Hades the underworld and Athena (Zeus daughter) the land. This unequal division will lead to jealousy and endless quarrels...

Object of the Game: Be the first player (or team of players) to capture 4 opposing gods.
To capture an opponent's tile a player must move one God or one Hero to sandwich this opponent tile during his turn.

Playing the Game: The active player performs his actions in the order of his choice: 
He must move one of his gods (compulsory action). 
Optionally, he can also move one of his heroes and/or try to recruit a new hero.

Your team at the start of the game is composed which 5 powerful Gods, in each team there is the fast (move twice), the strongest (push as tile), the beautiful (attract a tile), the flyer (jump over a tile) and the recruiter of more heroes. You start also with one hero but you will be able to recruit many of them to complete your army…

Name: Rosengarde: Legends of Spheria
Description:
Rosengarde is a cooperative role-playing adventure miniature board game for 1-4 players. The contents can also be combined with other future PROJECT ROSE System board games.

Set in the fantasy world of Spheria, it revolves around the legends of the Rosengarde and their fight against the monstrous plight threatening the world.

For centuries, the misshapen, malignant Antholons have plagued the underworld of Loriaé. The Rosengarde – stalwarts of war, who are bestowed with mysterious power and armed with steeled purpose – are all that stands between the monsters emerging from the depths of the mountains and the surface world.

In this game, you assume the role of a character and embark on dangerous quests into the monster-ridden subterranea. As you embark on a quest, fight through monsters, overcome challenges, and acquire more treasure and power, you must build up your momentum, and maintain a delicate balance between risks and rewards, in order to achieve ultimate victory.

It is also a story. Acquiring knowledge of the world and its people, proceed to make alliances, unravel mysteries, and seek the truth. Only through this you and the world in peril can attain salvation – or so it seems…

—description from the publisher

Name: Meytamon: Mega-Form
Description:
Participate in the Meytamon duel! These powerful and 
mythical creatures are your allies and will allow you to 
reach  victory! This family  card game is  accessible to 
all  and  introduce players  to  collectible  card  game 
mechanics. The games are quick to start with a single 
deck, shared  by all players and its  simple  strengths 
and weaknesses system and multiple effects cards will 
give  you  everything  you  need  to  develop  complex 
strategies. You can, both in group and solo mode, travel 
around  the  Meyta region.  The  solo  mode  includes  a 
brand new  way of playing  named Gotta  Draw ‘em All! 
Explore all roads and cities and face the Tournament of 
the  4 and  your lifelong  rival in  the Journey  mode, a 
unique role-playing card game!

—description from the designer

Name: Launch Land Expand: Ursa Prime
Description:
It is the year 2137 and the exoplanet Ursa Prime has just been discovered. The atmosphere is perfect for human life, abundant in natural resources and best of all completely devoid of intelligent life. Your corporation is now in a race to launch your ships, land on Ursa Prime and expand your claim. The effort will be costly and dangerous. You must balance your skills in negotiation and tactical combat while keeping an eye on your finances to prevent losing control of your corporation.

Your objective can be summarized in 3 words...Launch, Land, Expand.

The game is played in five rounds: 
The Card Round - Players try to collect a set to Launch their ships into Orbit.
The Purchase Round - Players place worker to perform actions like buying fuel, selling your shares and buying other player's shares.
The Orbit Round - Players spend fuel to move their ships along the orbit track.
The Planet Round - Players deploy troops from landed ships and battle for control of territories.
The Discard/Draw Round - Players discard and draw cards and check the Status Report to see if anyone meets the win conditions which are:
• Own controlling shares of your corporation (8 or more),
• Own 10 or more Galactic Credits,
• Own 9 or more territories on planet

Alternate win condition: if one player owns controlling shares of all other player's Corporations then the game is over and the controlling player wins.

-description from designer

Name: Smart10: Sommarspelen
Description: Fifty new double-sided cards with a hundred new questions.

Name: Smart10: Natur
Description: Fifty new double-sided cards with a hundred new questions.

Name: G.R.I.M. INC.: Gettin' Weird
Description:
G.R.I.M. INC. is expanding, with all the morbid mayhem you know and love!

The Gettin’ Weird pack gives you 60 new cards to add to your G.R.I.M. INC. deck! More death, more ridiculousness, more… Pies?

Requires the main game G.R.I.M. INC.

Extra rules exclusive to this deck (funnily enough, they are weird!).

—description from the publisher

Name: Diamant: Caution and Betrayal
Description: This expansion for Diamond contains 8 Warning tiles and 8 Betrayal cards. This expansion is definitely full of surprises! Steal your opponent's rubies with the Betrayal Module and deploy the Warning Module to taste the real danger with each new round!

Name: Alpha Pack
Description:
Slobbery, floppy canines are running amok! These furry mongrels are busy chasing cats, chewing on bones and digging holes. Will a dog whistle cause your Maltese to run away? Is there enough food for your set of Dalmatians? Do you have enough resources to give these pups a happy home? Your next turn might just make you the leader of Alpha Pack!

Players will take turns selecting cards (dogs, food/housing resources, or special cards) using an open drafting mechanism. Points are gained by competing for pack cards that have various requirements in order to collect said cards. During gameplay, events will occur that will affect the cards players hold. Once the pack cards have been claimed, players tally their collected pack cards and other points gained throughout the game. The player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: ALEA
Description:
ALEA is a dice game where the players move on the board, one at the time, from a dice roll and must execute the mini dice game of the square that they ended up to, to gain points.

There are nine different mini-games, and depending how far your marker is on the board, you used two or three dices to execute the mini-game. Some of the mini-games are like mini-challenge and if you fail to roll the right dices you lose points on the point grid.  There are also square where you must choose an opponent to play against, so you can win those or both players can loose points if they both failed. You can also ended up on square where you can't loose points.

Exemple of a mini-game with two dice:
'Double': you have to choose a wild number before rolling the dices, that number will act like a jocker. To make points you have to roll a pair. You roll three times and make 10 points for each pair you obtained.

The first player to reach 225 points, or as they say reach the Rubicon, win the game.

Name: Factory 42: Pro-Ukraine Promo Deck
Description:
When the news of the unprovoked, illegal and unimaginable Russian attack on Ukraine reached us, it was clear for us that we want to help in some way, even if our possibilities are limited.

We coordinated as a team and designed the Pro-Ukraine promo deck. Our graphic designer Lars Munck created a new matching illustration, and after some playtesting the new event cards were ready.

The Promo Deck contains a fully playable set of 9 new event cards (each in English and German).

We will donate all proceeds from the promo deck to the Finnish Red Cross, which is helping the people from Ukraine in this terrible situation.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Factory 42: Promo Deck
Description: The Kickstarter promo cards. Add three new "Free Sample" event cards to the Factory 42 game.

Name: Железници
Description:
Players take the roles of entrepreneurs in recently liberated Bulgaria.
At the turn of the 20th century, the knyaz and the government are unanimous that the path to the country's prosperity goes through the construction of a modern railway by the European model.
Adventurers from all over the country are joining the race to build new tracks.
Only one player will achieve the greatest success and become a true ruler of the railway industry!
Take over the management of your company - participate in project tenders, organize your workers, build railway lines and accumulate profits to achieve a glamorous victory.

The game uses a rondel mechanism where you can select one of several actions:

     Build
     Auction
     Profit
     Market
     Draft/Move


There are three resources used to build railway tracks:

     Steel
     Dynamite
     Money


Players also have a "Respect" rating. Higher respect gives a player better market prices for steel and dynamite, while actions that lose you respect will usually net you immediate short term profits.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ritual
Description:
Ritual is a social deduction game based on the comedy web series “The Cultists”, available on YouTube. The Yellow is everywhere, and the devoted followers of Yog-Sothoth, Dagon, Cthulhu, and Azathoth believe the cultists of the Yellow King are preparing to sacrifice the town to their dread master. There is only one thing the intrepid band of cultists can do to stop them — summon Cthulhu!
With Cthulhu on our side, the cult of the Yellow King won’t stand a chance!
    To summon Cthulhu, the cultists must complete five esoteric rituals, but they often go wrong! Is this because the cultists are just inept, or have the cultists of the Yellow King infiltrated the cult and are sabotaging it from within?
    Players are secretly divided into two teams - the Loyal Cultists and the sinister Agents of the Yellow. Players are free to make claims and accusations at any time throughout the game. The game will require discussion and deception, and, perhaps a bit of logic and luck.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Dead
Description:
The third cycle of the "Monsters" series features the cinematic 'slashers' of 1981-1990. All monsters and tactical cards (neutralizers) have unique powers from the other cycles. This third set adds a neutral area called the Dead Zone, which represents a parallel dimension, dream realm, or comatose hallucination. The Dreamstalker can trigger a card in the dead zone, the chainsaw-wielding Butcher or the machete-wielding Slasher can send monsters there, and Reanimation Serum can bring back a monster.

Each monster has an ability such as triggering the top card of your discard pile. You don't play cards from your hand; you take cards from a 4-card pool and trigger the card as you take it. At the end of the game players discard down to their best 2 cards. Then, tactical cards (neutralizers) destroy their corresponding monsters, and the player with the best surviving combination of cards wins.

Draw a card from the Pool, say its name and number aloud, and trigger/resolve its primary ability. (If another card gets triggered, reveal it and resolve it.) Fill the Pool back to 4 from the face-down deck. At the end of your turn, if you exceed your hand limit (3 cards), discard excess cards face-down to your discard pile. When the draw deck is empty, continue taking turns until everyone has had an equal number. Then Resolution begins.

RESOLUTION (combine / score your 2 cards)
All players discard down to just 2 cards. In turn order, each player dramatically reveals their highest-number card. Then they reveal their other card. Resolve all Neutralizers. The player with the highest total score wins the game. If there is a tie, the tied player with the highest-value surviving Monster is the winner.

At the end the game have the highest combined point total between your final 2 cards to win.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Marathon Race
Description:
"The Marathon Race" is a roll-and-move race game with a 167-space track based on the marathon course at the 1908 Olympics, with locations from Windsor Castle to White City Stadium.

Players landing on the "INN" spaces are compelled to divert on to the far longer alternative tracks that may ultimately place them at the head of the race. (Perhaps coincidentally, this presages a similar idea in Parker Bros. Pachisi variant, "Pollyanna," five years later.) There is also a "Snakes and Ladders"-style mechanic in which "STILE" spaces send players forward and "LOSE" spaces send them (sometimes very dramatically) back.

The first player to land on 167 exactly, without overshooting, wins; players then "line up" in order to receive the (imaginary) trophy.

(This information is extrapolated from Brian Love's 1978 book "Play the Game." Please modify with any expanded description or corrections that can be provided by the owner of a physical copy of the game.)

Name: From The Shadows
Description:
In From the Shadows, a Villain has sent their minions out unto the land to corrupt all living souls leaving the townsfolk of Forest Vale with the choice to either join or die. Players choose one of four heroes to venture out and kill these monsters, bringing back the trophies of their victories as proof for their bounties. Each player takes a turn performing their chosen action to ultimately gain the most victory points (VP). VP can be acquired by gaining Treasure, using Opportunities, and mainly by killing monsters. There are four classic villains that players may choose to go up against: Master Vampire, Alpha Werewolf, Zombie Horde, and Pharoah Mummy. Each villain’s deck is comprised of their minions to help drive the story.

From the Shadows is a turn based, light deck builder. Heroes begin the game with a deck of 15 cards, tailored to their abilities. During the game players can loot more cards from monsters they vanquish, building their deck and making their hero stronger. The final Villain is more difficult than his minions and basic monsters. Once a player kills the Villain the game is over and points are tallied.

—description from the publisher

Name: The New Exciting Game of Golfo
Description:
This is a straightforward 1–100 racing game, at least as present in Love's version, which features "adapted" rules (his term, unexplained). Players roll and move as expected, picking up 1 token if they are the first to reach or pass each of the 18 holes. (It is not clear if these successful players are supposed to pause at each hole and allow others to catch up, although "excess" rolls may be "counted against the next hole.")

Simple hazards are present in the form of hedges or bunkers, which cause players to lose 1 turn, or streams, which cause players to lose 1 turn and return to tee off from the start of the hole.

The winner is the first player to reach 100 exactly, claiming the remaining 3 tokens from the original 20-token pool.

(This information is extrapolated from Brian Love's 1978 book "Play the Game." Please modify with any expanded description or corrections that can be provided by the owner of a physical copy of the game.)

Name: Middleman
Description: Who says that average is boring? To win this game, you must keep close to the middle of the road. In Middleman, the players compete at whose answers are most consistently middling. The game comes with wipeable game parts and 200 task that will offer more than average entertainment for everyone!

Name: Center
Description:
Center is a game with a deceptively simple goal. It was invented by Alek Erickson and Michael Amundsen in 2022. The game is played on the cells of a hexhex board with sidelength 4 or on the intersections of a 9x9 Go board. A Chess board (which is 8x8 squares) also has 9x9 intersections, and therefore works as a Center board.

Rules:
Players take turns placing one stone at a time. 
A placement N steps away from the perimeter must have at least N friendly pieces in sight.
The winner is the player who places a stone on the very center of the board.

On the square board, pieces see in all 8 directions.

—description from the designer

Name: Wer schafft es am schnellsten?
Description:
The players take turns moving their meeple. The start at the numbered spaces at the bottom of the board and have to get to the target spaces at the top of the board.

Movement is one space per turn or one or more jumps over red spaces (similar to halma or checkers). The fastest player to reach a target space wins the game.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 12/80.

—user summary

Name: Alwin Weihnachts-Würfelspiel
Description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 68 to win the game. If they get on a space with a heart, their next roll counts double. On a space with a star the next roll counts double too, but to move backwards!

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 12/87.

—user summary

Name: Anthromancer
Description:
Anthromancer is a tabletop game system that features a suite of original neoclassical strategy and chance games, as well as an original oracle. It is primarily organized around a 2-4 player abstract strategy game called 'Mercenarium'.

In Mercenarium, players take turns placing and moving cards with various edge values in an attempt to overcome the edge values of opposing cards and capture them. The first player to capture 5 cards wins. Captures can be spent to gain control of enemy cards which pivot to the orientation of the buyer, changing the relative strengths on the battlefield and subverting enemy plans. In addition, each player is dealt 1 of 15 unique 'hymn' cards, which grant powerful abilities that dramatically alter the board state.

The game feels a bit like chess, but with far less predictability, due to the randomness of the deck and the asymmetrical powers of the hymns. Skill is gained by learning to predict patterns of movement, and being willing to take risks.

Name: Grab Your Breakfast
Description:
Grab your Breakfast is a family light drafting game about grabbing the heartiest breakfast possible.

There will be a sumptuous spread on the table ... pancakes, cereal, bagels and cups of coffee. Start collecting what you would like for your breakfast.

But you'll need more than luck to win. Some food are worth more points than others so you have to plan what to collect. Reveal hidden food items as you play the game and get bonus points for special combinations of cards you collect. Be careful about penalty points if you don't let others collect the items you want!

—description from the publisher

Name: Kamigami Battles: The Stars Are Right
Description: Among other things, Kamigami Battles: The Stars Are Right contains six new gods and one new location for use with any Kamigami Battles standalone game.

Name: Kamigami Battles: Into the Dreamlands
Description: Among other things, Kamigami Battles: Into the Dreamlands contains six new gods and one new location for use with any Kamigami Battles standalone game.

Name: City Control
Description:
City Control is a worker placement and area majority game where the aim is to have control of as many buildings in the city as possible.
The placement of workers allows combinations that can change the game.
To do this, you will have to send your teams into the buildings and gain influence on the eminent people 
who are inside.
Whoever scores the most points wins. Points are earned by controlling buildings with your own teams.

—description from the designer

Name: Kingdom Builder: Empire Edition
Description:
Supersize your Kingdom Builder experience with the Empire Edition.

This super-sized product includes custom shaped plastic houses with a different design for each player color, as well as 3D castles. In order to accommodate the larger houses, all of the player boards are 25% larger as well.

Additionally, the Empire Edition includes all new artwork on the box and cards, as well as bakelite location tokens.

Also includes The Emperor's Choice promo pack of "Twist" cards (first featured in Winter Kingdom) that can add a new rule to each game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: DC Deck-Building Game: Crossover Pack 9 – DC Bombshells
Description: You can add this expansion to any base game to play as iconic female Super Heroes as they join the Allied forces in World War II. Use the new Bombshell Attack cards to unleash explosive effects that help you to victory! The cards feature incredible art directly from the comics.

Name: Aero Flights
Description:
This race game commemorates the 1909 flight from France to England by  aviator Louis Bieriot and offers players the chance to make the return trip. Players compete as aviators to cross the English channel using a single die and a board made up of small square spaces.

If players roll 1, 2, 3, or 4, they may move that number of spaces in any direction they choose. Rolling 5 or 6 compels them to use a compass-styled spinner to determine which direction they will go. Two planes that would land on the same space must compete by rolling the die; the winning higher number keeps the space, while the loser drops south by the number of spaces rolled.

Planes that would go off the edge into the "sky" cannot move that turn. Planes that fall in the sea must go back to the start. Planes that hit the cliffs on either side of the board are eliminated outright!

The winner is the first pilot to land their aircraft "on one of the squares of the Finish." They may overshoot the winning roll without negative consequence.

Name: Diamond Keepers
Description:
Diamond Keepers is a four to six player tabletop turn based card game, where each player takes the role of the protector of a kingdom and their most valuable resource Diamonds.

The legend says that the one who possesses one diamond from each kingdom will rule the world.

This game is turned based, and in each turn the players can use different types of cards to either steal other player diamonds, protect themselves or their allies, or even alter the flow of the match.

—description from the publisher

Name: Marks of Legend: The Spire of Deren'nuk
Description:
In this solitaire storytelling bookmark game, craft a legend from the pages of a book!

Choose a place in any book, and search for words on those pages to fill the blanks of a heroic legend, chapter by chapter. The words you use affect which words you must find to perform a series of feats. Perform every feat before you run out of words to finish your legend.

This game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In-Hand Game Design Contest.

—description from the designer

Name: Spyrol
Description:
This is a race game for 2 or 4 players, with some aspects of both Ludo and Snakes and Ladders. As in Ludo, the goal is for each player to get all four of their counters to the Home space, in this case the very center of a long spiral. Counters of different colors may capture each other, while two or more counters of the same color may form a Barrier that cannot be captured or passed.

There are also seven Ladders set on the board to reach across rings of the spiral. A counter which lands at the base of a Ladder will shoot to the other end, capturing any opposing piece in the Ladder's path.

The game may be based on the older and more complex Willy's Walk to see Grandmamma, which features a similar layout.

Name: Argos2022 Space Backpack + R05Y-J
Description:
A space adventure in 2 parts and in solo : 2 r'n'w that will propel you on Argos to try to terraform the planet and a trip to its moon R05Y-J to search for traces of life.
Each r'n'w is a standalone but in the same universe. You can play Argos than R05Y-J to an excited journey.
Roll 4 dice, check the damages on your ship, try to exctract hydrogen and ore to activate modules, Argos it's a little bit maths but a lot of stress.

Name: I Would Destroy The Ring
Description:
A nerdy expansion deck. From space odysseys to long walks through magical lands, this deck brings you 200 exclusive cards that you won't find anywhere else and can be played as a stand-alone.

—description from the publisher

Name: Манчкин: Гравити Фолз
Description:
This is the best summer in your life, Munchkin! A small town in Oregon holds many secrets for you to discover.
Choose from 10 favorite characters like Dipper, Wendy or Old Man McGucket and go on an adventure. Dangerous monsters are waiting for you, from annoying gnomes to the insidious Bill Cipher and his team from the Nightmare Dimension. Call your true friends Candy, Courageous Dan and Lazy Susan for help, arm yourself with Nyarf, Owl Scoop and Electric Gloves, fill your pockets with Fairy Dust and Smiles - then no curses will be afraid of you!

ÐœÐ°Ð½Ñ‡ÐºÐ¸Ð½: Ð“Ñ€Ð°Ð²Ð¸Ñ‚Ð¸ Ð¤Ð¾Ð»Ð· ("Munchkin: Gravity Falls") introduces a new type of card into the game - mystery cards. Each mystery card will give you two useful abilities, but keep in mind that monsters and other munchkins will not let you use them easily!

Name: Color Addict Puzzle
Description:
In this dominoes-like variant of Color Addict, players must lay out their cards so that the edges match the color patterns on cards that have already been played. If a player is unable to act on his turn, he draws one of the "joker" black and white cards.

The goal is to be the first player to get rid of all of his cards.

Name: Chakravyuha: Trading Card Game
Description:
Chakravyuha Trading Card Game (TCG) is a battle strategy game that is inspired by ancient Indian texts of Mahabharata, Ramayana, and Puranas.

Ancient texts from India are filled with stories of Yodhas (legendary warriors) with extraordinary skills and strength that they had acquired through Education (Shiksha), Practice (Sadhana), and Penance (Tapasya).

Equipped with Vardaans (divine blessings) and Astras (divine weapons of incomparable strengths) these Yodhas elevated themselves to the level of Rathi (5000 times stronger than a Yodha); Atirathi (12 times stronger than a Rathi), or Maharathi (12 times stronger than an Atirathi).  So a Maharathi has the strength of 720,000 Yodhas!

However, some Yodhas were also weakened by curses (Shraaps) by divinities that these warriors had wronged through their actions (Karma).

In Chakravyuha TCG, you command an army (Sena) of Yodhas and strengthen them with Astras and Vardaans while weakening the opposing army with Shraaps and other effects of your superhuman warriors and their weapons.

Chakravyuha Trading Card Game (TCG) is a battle strategy game that is inspired by this part of the ancient Indian texts. In this game, you as a General command an army (Sena) of Yodhas and strengthen them with Astras and Vardaans while weakening the opposing army with Shraaps and other effects of your superhuman warriors and their weapons.

—description from the designer

Name: Mechanisms
Description:
Mechanisms is a game of moving tiles and scoring points.

Players compete to add points to their own towers and keep points away from their opponents. Each turn, players use 1-3 action cards to move tiles and cards around the play space.

In addition to the actions they take on their own turn, players may place Chain tokens on cards they have previously played to take additional actions during opponent turns.

Finally, players gain access to various upgrades, including deckbuilding, whenever someone draws a tile from the top of their tower. Each round players must weigh whether to take an early upgrade or wait for a larger draw and, thus, a better upgrade.

—description from the designer

Name: Mastro Alice
Description:
The game was conceived by Aldo Spinelli in 1989 and develops on a chessboard of 4 squares per side. 
Each player has a traditional six-sided die, which is moved from one square to another in an orthogonal direction, rotating on an edge of his choice as many times as the value expressed by the top face. 
The dice can change direction after each rotation and can also retrace the squares already traveled during the same move. The die can only pass into empty squares. 
The player who manages to finish his move in the square occupied by the opponent wins, so that, after the last rotation, his die shows on the upper face a value identical to that indicated at that moment by the upper face of the enemy die.

Name: Netsvis
Description:
The game is inspired by the Etruscan divination art and is an interpretation of how dice could have been used more than 2500 years ago. 
The Netsvis board reproduces the sacred Etruscan space and can be used both alone, to draw the wishes of the day, and in competition with other players, having as its objective the challenge to Fate with the simple throw of the dice.
How to play.

     Netsvis is a solitaire where you face pure destiny, destiny and what governs all the daily events behind it. It can be used as a divination tool (do I win or does Fate win?) But it is also a competitive pastime towards oneself. In fact, it is possible to numerically evaluate the outcome of the single game and gradually try to obtain better and better results. In this way it is also possible to compete with the participation of more players in succession of time.
     The two dice act alternately as dice and checkers. The white die W is favorable, the one that could win. The black die B is the unfavorable one, the one that could make you lose.
     At the start of the game, B is placed in the gray box in the lower center. It doesn't matter what value is shown on the top face of him.
     You roll W with your right hand and, starting from the square occupied by B, advance it to the right to the first square that shows the same image of the face that came out in the roll of the dice. Here the die W stops while B remains in his place.
     Now take B and throw it with your left hand. The result of the shot causes B to move to the first square corresponding to the exit face, starting from the position of W but in the opposite direction, ie to the left. Now two clarifications are necessary. The first, completely connected to superstition, is linked to the traditional beneficial influence of the right hand (which must be used to roll the white dice) while the left has always been considered a bearer of misfortune. The second clarification is fundamental for the purposes of the game. When the rule says: "Bring B into the first square on the left starting from the one occupied by W" it means that a possible release of the colors magenta, yellow or blue in this first throw of B will make it move to the right with respect to its initial position but " however "to the left of the white die.
     After placing B in the corresponding square, W is taken from the square in which it is and raised (with the right hand) and then moved to the right up to the first square equal to the exit face. Also in this case the reference to the starting point of the displacement of W is the square in which B stands.
     And so on, toss after toss in a continuous back and forth that leads W to the right arm of the board and brings B back to the left. The game continues until one of the two dice cannot move because it is in such a position that there is no square in front of it with the symbol that came out in that roll. If it is W, it is placed on the top white square and the player has won.
     If it is B, it is moved to the top black box and the player has lost. So it's fate that won the game!
     You can only win with an odd number of rolls and lose with an even number. This distinction also has its own symbolic meaning ... And you can win with a few moves or after a tiring sequence of rolling the two dice. Likewise, if Fate is adverse, a few moves may be enough to reach the nefarious black box. If you manage to stall, you must never lose hope: the arrangement of the numbers on the board can often turn the tables in our favor.

Name: Spellstorm
Description:
A tactical deckbuilder for 1-4 players, from the creator of Dragon Bridge.

Set in the Gem Wizards Universe (Gem Wizards Tactics, Dragon Bridge). Spellstorm features the ninja bug-man Omar Evans, the Business Demon Intern Derby Pocket, radical activist skeleton Eve Williams, and a bunch of exciting new characters, each with their own powers and gameplay mechanics.

In Spellstorm, 1-4 wizards do battle, casting a sequence of spells in order, slowly unfolding their tactics and overwhelming the opponent with powerful summons, using a never-before-seen kind of deckbuilding system paired with a simultaneous action system.

Eight Wizards have met at the Spellstorm to obtain the Storm Shards, powerful magic artifacts that can only be gained once every 1,000 years. Who among you is skilled enough to weather the vicious storm?

Choose from 8 wildly asymmetrical characters with their own unique magical powers. Will you win by having a strong economy, purchasing powerful Gems and even Dragons? Will you rush them down with red Fire cards? Or do you lean more into the long-term Ice magics, overwhelming the opponent's deck and causing them to slide helplessly into the depths of the Spellstorm. You'll constantly have to adapt your strategy after each battle.

Players draft a new card between each battle, slightly shifting their strategy. During a battle, players simultaneously play Spell cards, blasting each other and dealing damage.

Spellstorm is a game that's easy to learn but takes years to master all of its systems.

-description from publisher

Name: The Thing: Human Miniatures Set 2
Description:
The Thing – The Boardgame is an intense game experience for 1-8 players based on the 1982 cult movie directed by John Carpenter. It is a game that mixes different mechanics to create an experience that is as faithful as possible to that of the original movie.

The Thing: Human miniatures expansion contains a set of four highly detailed character miniatures, to use in place of the Characters standees you can find into the base game box.

These miniatures represent 4 of second characters seen in the movie, such as Copper or Palmer.

Using these Character miniatures in place of the standees enriches the game, giving it a more scenic aspect and a stronger impact to the gameplay.

Name: Mysthea: Monsters Set
Description:
The Miniature Bundle completes the Monsters Miniatures set in addition to those already included in Mysthea: Essential Edition.

Contents:

3 Additional Monster Miniatures: 
Boulron the Reaper
Kodror the Infestation
Obsidusa the Devourer

With related cards and 1 English rulesheet.

Name: The Sandwich Guy
Description:
You are The Sandwich Guy, whose food truck is known far and wide as a premier foodie destination. You're given a non-stop barrage of ingredients, which you use to make sandwiches... of variable quality.

Starting with a hand of eight cards, each turn you choose three cards to discard as a "sandwich." The only rule is that the three must be equally distant from each other (e.g., 2-3-4, or 3-6-9, or 5-5-5, etc.). You then draw a number of cards based on the "quality" of your sandwich: if it all cards discarded were of the same suit, you draw four; if all three were of the same color but two different suits, you draw three (that is, you get back the same amount you discarded); if the cards were of different colors, you only get back two.

The game consists in decisions about when to play certain cards and when to hold on to them, having a good idea of what's left in the deck and what's not, and in keeping your hand size healthy enough to stay in business. If you would draw the last card, you win; if you cannot make a sandwich out of your ingredients, you lose.

The game can be played entirely in-hand, holding the deck of cards with the ingredients on top and the discard pile face-up below.

As part of the Isaludo collection, the rules can be found in this forum thread.

Name: Provisions 1849
Description:
THEME: By the summer of 1849, the California Gold Rush was in full swing. In this fast-moving game, you and your fellow players own competing General Stores in a boomtown where new gold was just discovered. You must battle it out selling specific supplies to the gold prospectors flooding into town. But first you must either buy the goods from local suppliers or trade with a devious gang of vigilantes when supplies become too scarce. And of course, you must move quickly to make your fortune; because in just 6 months, the gold will run out in this town and the prospectors will move on to another!

GAME PLAY: The game is played over 6 Rounds – one for each month from July through December. Each Round has 2 Phases: Production Phase and Buy/Sell/Trade Phase.

During the Production Phase, each of the 8 Suppliers produce Goods (or has Goods stolen by the Vigilantes!). Production is random based on the Production Cards that are chosen each round, so some goods may quickly become scarce!

During the Buy/Sell/Trade Phase, players either buy Goods from the Suppliers, sell the Goods needed by a Prospector to make a sale and claim the Prospector Card, or trade Goods with the Vigilantes.

Some claimed Prospector Cards include a Contract Goods bonus which can be used to make future sales – making this an “engine-building” game!

Play continues for 6 rounds (representing 6 months) with special rules at the end of September when the Vigilantes flee and drop their stolen goods for players to grab, and during the final month of December when the gold has run out and prospectors are stocking up quickly to move on to the next boomtown.

GOAL OF THE GAME: Win the game by collecting the most Provision Points from completed sales to the Prospectors, as well as Bonus Points from individual Bonus objectives achieved at the end of the game.

-description from designer

Name: Rival Troops
Description:
In Rival Troops, players explore a campground, adding new sites to the expanding area. Players will move their troops around the board, trying to position themselves in the best sites to set up camp. At the end of the game, players will score points for the sites that they've claimed, as long as they have the majority of troops on a site.

—description from the designer

Name: Farmen: Kampen for tilværelsen
Description:
This game is heavily based on the successful show Farmen at TV2's TV-channel.

You play the game by rolling a dice, collecting milkbuckets on your road. After collecting enough milkbuckets you could either spend it on money (buying resources), or buying knifes (counting as points when scoring to win).

Name: The Dark Quarter: Lost to the Night
Description:
Thirteen year old Susanna has disappeared without a trace and the NOPD are powerless to find her. A band of misfits, brought together by their connections to Susanna, will do what the police cannot and bring her home!

While not investigators themselves, this group congregates around "The Alligator" club and have seen the dark and magical underbelly of New Orleans with their own eyes. They also know that Susanna might well be connected to the arcane as she is no ordinary teenager.

With Susanna's life on the line, the stakes will be higher and more personal than ever.

What's Inside:

     3 feature-length scenarios
     30 location tiles
     3 scene tiles
     21 NPC markers
     28 consumable cards
     21 story cards


Characters:

     Jane 'Bluejay' Tien: The Sister
     Hector Zavaleta: The Protector
     Fermin 'One-Eye' Lafayette: The Teacher
     Evelyn Dansky: The Mother


Each character comes with:

     1 character board
     1 32mm miniature
     9 ability cards


Miniatures:

     1 Small NPC Mini (~32mm)
     1 Medium NPC Mini (~44mm)
     1 Honey Island Swamp Monster (~70mm)

Name: The Dark Quarter: The Yesterday Demon & Other Stories
Description: The Yesterday Demon & Other Stories takes place before the events depicted in The Dark Quarter and features four all-new standalone scenarios, each highlighting a single Beaumont Agent and their (inevitably) tragic pasts.

Name: Pestilence
Description:
Pestilence is a roll and write, print at home board game set in 17th century Europe, at the height of the Plague. With the city locked down, and swarms of rats infesting every street, the civilans are left to an almost certain death. There is, however, an underground network asssisting people’s escape. You must gain supplies and bolster your reputation to convince the network to help you escape, all while avoiding the watchful eye of the king’s men!

Just grab a pencil, print out a board, and you're ready to go!

Name: 에어라인 81 (Airline 81)
Description:
Currently, Airline 81 is severely underperforming. All players will participate in the game as the new management of Airline 81 Airlines, and must strive to normalize airline performance. Management expects that the new aircraft A81 introduced to normalize its performance will play a role as a game changer.

The goal of the game is to operate the A81 aircraft in an efficient manner, producing high performance.

The game board and auxiliary game board are placed in the center, and the player takes a personal board with the same color as his cube according to the number of players. The game starts with a first player and runs several rounds clockwise.

In player turn, each player proceeds in the order of the next three steps.
1. [Rolling the dice]
The player rolls three dice at the same time in his turn and distinguishes the top color of each dice. Designate A for the same color on the top of each die and B and C for the different colors. 
(Example: Yellow+yellow+red = A+A+B / Blue+Purple+Red = A+B+C / Blue+Blue+Blue= A+A+A)
2. [Choose 1 out of 2 tasks]
The player chooses one of the two tasks(flight Service, staff training) in his turn and behavior once.
 - Task 1: Flight Service
 - Task 2: Staff Training
3. [Moving score markers based on behavior]
Move the score marker according to the player's behavior immediately.

The next player will also continue in the same way in the three-step order, and the round will end when all players play once. As several rounds progress, if the cube is no longer available after one's turn(if there is no A81 reservation), the game ends after only the corresponding round.

At the end of the game, the A81 aircraft management performance(passenger fare score, employee training score, reservation waiting score, checked baggage import performance, profitability improvement performance, marketing performance) is all calculated and the player with the highest total wins.
If the total is tied, the player with more colored cubes in the business class wins. If it is still a tie, more players will win the cube(reserved waiting) remaining on the individual board, and if it is still a tie, they will win jointly.

Name: Chocoloco
Description:
Chocoloco is a casual card game of chocolate swapping and order filling for 2-4 players. Each player manages their hand, which can have chocolate and action cards. Players may play any or all of their cards on their turn before drawing back up. Players arrange chocolates on the table to try and fill orders to score points.

The catch? You have to work to build your own order combos while blocking your opponents. Oh, and there's a limited set of orders. The easy ones go fast, so plan ahead! It's kind of like a certain candy-swapping puzzle game but made with cards where players can mess with the board of chocolates — and each other!

All players share the cards on the table and may use any of them to complete and score orders. Get 15 points to win a round (or 10 points to have faster rounds). Once you win a round, you gain a Round Winner card. Win 2 rounds and win the game.

Reimplements Crazy Cake Bakery.

Name: The Irregular Miniatures Ancient Rule Box
Description:
Thank you for buying this set of rules. Their aim is to produce an enjoyably fast yet realistic game from the Biblical period to Medievals.

The rules are designed for use with the Irregular Miniatures 6mm strips or blocks, but having said that, they can be used with any scale of figures with the relevant changes to ranges and groundscale. Using the Irregular Miniatures 2mm Ancient bases and halving the firing and movement distances, being an ideal case in point. The 2mm range is comprised of a full selection of all the necessary Elephants, Chariots, Cavalry and Infantry.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Charter
Description:
The First Sovereignty spread humanity to every corner of the galaxy, but eons have passed since its fall, and the countless worlds once under its thumb became no more than whispered legends to one another. Now, a potent new FTL advancement, which rumors say emerged from the cryptic galactic core, grants humanity the hope of travel to the farthest stars in a single lifetime. You are one of the few with the mettle to give up your planet-bound life and become a STAR CHARTER.

Star Charter is a card-driven solitaire game where you play a star charter, striking out from your home planet to travel the space lanes and the vast void, discovering long-lost worlds of a densely inhabited galaxy. When you have discovered three new worlds, you have won the game, but it is possible to become adrift in space and lose. Whether you win or lose, the known galaxy has the potential to grow with each new game.

This is a “Make-as-You-Play” game, which means that the game starts with a few materials (a map, paper, index cards, and colored cubes) and the remaining components will be generated as needed during play. Each game will see the addition of new cards, which represent the worlds in the galaxy.

The game rules include tables and guidelines for making new cards as needed, and this makes every copy of Star Charter an evolving galaxy. In addition, it means that each game inherits all components added or changed in the previous games. The galaxy’s worlds can grow endlessly over a connected campaign as players return to see what each new era holds for the future of humanity.

—description from the designer

Name: Bamse och Vulkanön
Description:
Travel to the North Pole with Bamse and his friends

Go on an adventure and research trip to the North Pole to look for different animals. With a little luck, you can get help from Bamse, Lille Skutt and Skalman. With a little bad luck, you risk loose some animal between the stations. To try to save your animals, you do different challenges. The one who first filled his tray with animals has won.

Name: iina
Description:
iiná is a solitaire 18-card in-hand game that places the player in control of a Navajo tribe in the 1600’s, as they fight to survive and preserve their culture during the Spanish invasion of the North American continent.

This game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In Hand Game Design Contest and was placed as follows:

		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		

—description from the designer

Name: Cinema Code
Description:
There are illustrated cards that captured famous scenes from 80 different movies.

Cinema Code is a party game that players try to guess the movie card which is referred by the clues given by a presenter.

Game Play
(1) Set the movie cards to make a 6x5 grid. 
(2) One player becomes a presenter and takes a ticket card which indicates a movie card on the table. 
(3) The presenter draws a hint token from the bag and place it on any other movie card to give a clue.

    There are four types of hint tokens: icons, colors, locations, and genres. 
    The presenter may give up to five clues. 


(4) The other players look at the hint tokens and find 'the movie card' that presenter is trying to tell. 

    As more hints get drawn, the points players will get reduces. 


(5) Replace the movie cards and the next player becomes a new presenter.

Name: Vigilante: Hidden Motives
Description:
In Hidden Motives, your super hero teams will gain a new secret hideout. The new "Lair" mechanic adds asymmetric abilities for each player including unique new actions that each player can take.

In addition to a variety of lairs, Hidden Motives adds a ton of new content to further increase variability, including Scenarios, Heroes, Villains, Identities, Equipment, and more! New abilities add a new dimension to the game, without increasing complexity.

This is an expansion, that requires Vigilante to play.

-description from designer
